snippet: A hundred years ago, craft guilds, facing a new world of corporations, rebuilt their power as industry-based unions. Their clout and numbers again in decline, another reinvention may be called for.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column says that organized labor is in free fall and in dire need of a reinvention as unions are increasingly seeing their clout and numbers decline; suggests that an examination of labor history may provide answers as to how the movement might recover its strength and relevance to American workers and society.
lead_paragraph: A hundred years ago, craft guilds, facing a new world of corporations, rebuilt their power as industry-based unions. Their clout and numbers again in decline, another reinvention may be called for.
